alert.note: Alert for Monroe (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 3:55PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Monroe County through 430 PM EDT... At 354 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Skytop, or 7 miles northeast of Mount Pocono, moving south at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mount Pocono, Tobyhanna, Henryville, Paradise Valley, Analomink, Gouldsboro State Park, Skytop, Mountainhome, Canadensis, Alpine Mountain and Cresco. This includes Interstate 380 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 5 and 12. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
